comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
In the 1911 census, there is a John Roderick Segrave, Commander Royal Navy, born 1872, Reunion, living with his wife - Mary Stephanie Segrave (35, born London) and son - William Francis Segrave (3, born London) living at Hill House, London Rd, Kirkley, Lowestoft. 

There is a death record for John R Segrave, age 66, in Sep qtr 1938, Lambeth Registration District and a probate record leaving £26878 17s 5d to William Orr Campbell Major HM Army and Edmund Lawson solicitor. He also appears in the Navy lists and medal roll

comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Captain John R Segrave was awarded the French Legion of Honour for distinguished services rendered during the war on 18 JUNE 1918

comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Captain Segrave record in the Naval Medals and Decorations Roll shows that when his war medals 1914 -1918 Star Victory and British war Medal were issued he was part of League of Nations Commission in Geneva
